title: The Castle of Cagliostro
summary: The Castle of Cagliostro, known in Japan as Lupin III: Cagliostro no Shiro,[lower-alpha 1] is a 1979 Japanese animated action-adventure comedy film co-written and directed by Hayao Miyazaki. It is the second feature film featuring Monkey Punch's master thief Ars√®ne Lupin III, from his manga series Lupin III.[2] The film was Miyazaki's directorial debut after having previously worked as an animator for Toei Animation and Telecom Animation Film and directing several television shows, including Lupin the Third Part I.
